issue.title: MS/MS Data Should List Charge State of Parent Ion

content.raw:
Hi, thanks for the report. Unfortunately, I can't reproduce the problem, as for the data I have the precursor ion charge state is reported (although may not be very easy to find):


```
#!python

>>> s['precursorList']['precursor'][0]['selectedIonList']['selectedIon'][0]['charge state']
3.0

```

If it's not there for your data, it would be great if you could provide a sample of it so that I can reproduce and fix the problem.
content.html:
Hi, thanks for the report. Unfortunately, I can't reproduce the problem, as for the data I have the precursor ion charge state is reported (although may not be very easy to find):

>>> s['precursorList']['precursor'][0]['selectedIonList']['selectedIon'][0]['charge state']
3.0

If it's not there for your data, it would be great if you could provide a sample of it so that I can reproduce and fix the problem.
